snippet.title: Amy Schumer Is Done With Fan Selfies

localized.description:
Should fans feel entitled when it comes to celebrities and taking photos with them? That issue came up recently when Amy Schumer alleged that she was bombarded by a fan who took selfies with her even after she asked him to not. Ana Kasparian, John Iadarola (ThinkTank), and Jimmy Dore, hosts of The Young Turks, break it down. Tell us what you think in the comment section below.

"Sharing a photo of the fan who allegedly left her shaken in South Carolina yesterday, Amy wrote on Instagram: “This guy in front of his family just ran up next to me scared the sh*t out of me.

"Put a camera in my face. I asked him to stop and he said ‘no it’s America and we paid for you’ this was in front of his daughter. I was saying stop and no. Great message to your kid.

"Yes legally you are allowed to take a picture of me. But I was asking you to stop and saying no. I will not take picture with people anymore and it’s because of this dude in Greenville.”

Amy went on to add that she doesn’t “owe” her fans anything, writing on Twitter: “I’ll still take pictures with nice people when I choose to if it’s a good time for that.”*

Read more here: https://www.yahoo.com/style/amy-schumer-bans-fans-from-taking-selfies-i-134309144.html

Hosts: Ana Kasparian, John Iadarola,  Jimmy Dore

Cast: Ana Kasparian, John Iadarola,  Jimmy Dore
